dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sound. We are in a speeding SUV. The passenger, LARA, unsnaps her seat belt and reaches for the door handle. Th driver, JOHN, sees her door open and dives to GRAB her. T SUV spins, HORNS BLARE, TIRES SCREECH, cars swerve to avo collision. We aren't sure what is happening, but we know something has gone terribly wrong. Cut to BLACK. Read:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two couples sit at a table, picking at dessert, JOHN and LARA BRENNAN on one side, MICK and ERIT on the other. JOH is attractive in a worn kind of way, but has the eyes of kid with a discipline problem. You have to really know hi to understand if he is mocking you or agreeing with you. is a master of irony and has a true enjoyment of the absu LARA looks beautiful even in her wrinkled suit. She appea to have had a hard day at the office. She's been drinking at dinner; it hasn't eased her nerves. John's good-lookin brother, MICK, boasts his blue collar roots and a gorgeou if slightly trashy, girlfriend, ERIT, who isn't ashamed o her body or sharing her opinions. JOHN and MICK are laugh Lara puts cash on the tray beside Mick's credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? If you were smart you would stop talking right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue me. I just know that women should never work for women. John laughs and applauds.   Mick buries his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're always threatened. Especially if you're beautiful and they're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erit, you are so full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, your boss isn't threatened by you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she's a bitch! -- (as John and Mick laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Not because she's a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you would describe her as "attractive"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That has nothing to do with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there is my answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either of you like another drink? Lara shoots John a burning look as Erit builds on her vic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women should work under men, men under women. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (egging her on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But men under men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine, too. (the men burst into laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're used to it! Why are you laughing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Erit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, bro, but I think I'd rather work under you than her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted, shoots back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please, I'd rather work under him, too. That was a dig at Mick but Lara is primed for a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd rather "work under" John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a problem with that, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, why would I have a problem with your little sexual innuendo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is up your ass tonight?? Mick throws John a "This is all your fault and now it is going to explode" look. John feigns complete innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I shouldn't take offense that you're coming on to my husband right in front of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (claws out now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara, if I wanted your husband I would have him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? You couldn't possibly show him more of your tits. The men are on their feet before blows are exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You know what your problem is?!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN MICK
dialogues.text: That was a great meal!           Okay--okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick and Erit head toward Mick's sporty pickup.     John Lara step into foreground, Lara still fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is completely full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T try and agree with me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I don't even believe she is in the dental profession. Lara knows this game; he is trying to get her out of her black mood, and she has no intention of letting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet she can't even spell anesthesiologist. Woman's a complete fraud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went to her office party, idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she hit on me that night, too. Lara opens the back door of their black Prius and tosses the raincoat she was carrying. They climb in, under....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are completely delusional. She wasn't even hitting on you in there; I just don't like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. People who look like that should not be allowed anywhere near oral surgery. She feels a smile coming to her lips and tries to force i away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the chair trying to stay calm; how are you supposed to do that with those things hanging over your-- She can't stand how attractive he is in this moment -- sh stops him short by kissing him passionately. His hands sl under her blouse; she tugs at his sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's going to -- Her hand goes to his pants. He yanks at the seat lever an it goes crashing back, Lara landing atop him. After a moment he sits up quickly and pushes down the vis She laughs and kisses him and they disappear into each ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara and John enter, Lara carrying her raincoat, her hair sticking up in the back, John's shirt untucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! JENNA, the teenage baby-sitter, sees right through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he cry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when I dropped him down the stairs. Lara shoots her a look, hangs up her coat and exits upsta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She peeks in her son's room, sees him sleeping soundly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara comes down to find John paying Jenna. John nods for her to check the mirror. She tugs at the knot in her hair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.   See you next weekend. Jenna exits. Lara shows him that his sweater is inside ou John reacts: "Oh God." Lara's smile broadens; she kisses him. He pins her to the wall and they start all over agai He feels for the light switch. He finds it; we cut to BLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara wakes, troubled.      It's the middle of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara finds Luke's window closed but unlocked. She locks i and looks out. Satisfied, she sits and watches her son sl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three year-old LUKE holds a knife and fork as he sits at table watching his dad cut up his pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, your turn. Luke skewers a piece with his fork.        Lara passes, h to get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, very good...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luke puts it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no; you feed me. (to Lara)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son is hopeless. Lara grabs her phone and leans over them to take a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squeeze in tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this every morning.   It is way too corny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile.   It's just until he's eighteen. It flashes. Lara kisses John, puts an alien-looking elect toothbrush on the table & walks off to pour coffee to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, you have to stop believing everything you read in a catalogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate brushing your teeth; this one brushes them in thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if stung)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love brushing my teeth. (to Luke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lies your mother tells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's your last class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, and I have papers to grade. Can you pick up Luke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After yesterday I probably don't have a job anyway. Do you think it was wrong to call her a useless cow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosses admire that kind of frank                          exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls note off fridge) Did you call your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading for bathroom) "When?" Yesterday, for his birthday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara puts her foot up and jabs herself with insulin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent him flowers and a handmade card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're completely impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you notice what I got for my birthday this year? A grunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom said Happy Birthday and my father went <grunts>. Made me tear up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara returns, trying hard not to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever think that someone has to be the bigger person here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Luke) Remember this for the custody hearing: how Mommy is always scolding Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you going to feel if Luke grows up and doesn't call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara can't keep a straight face and heads to the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's driving a wedge between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now she is abandoning you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara grabs her raincoat and notices a stain on the back shoulder. Irritated, she heads back to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara rinses the stain under the sink, surprised to see it run red. She looks at her hands: blood. The doorbell ring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John rises to answer the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara looks at her coat, wonders how the hell she got bloo on her shoulder. She rubs liquid soap into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John opens the door, DETECTIVE QUINN shows his badge. DETECTIVE COLLERO and a team of detectives push past. Joh has no time to react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police.   Mr. Brennan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUKE sees the police rush past him and gets scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Detective Quinn. This is a search warrant for these premises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hears Luke cry and instinctively heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops him) Stay where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touch me again and you'll be arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara steps from the bathroom and is met by Detective Coll She sees the coat with the water spot; nods to a team mem who takes it and bags it under:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara Brennan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara Brennan, you are under arrest for the murder of Elizabeth Gesas. She takes her wrist and professionally turns and cuffs he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead??     Elizabeth is dead??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to push past)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will only --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him in cuffs. The uniform pushes him up against the wall and cuffs his wrists. John watches as his child cries, his wife is led out in handcuffs and the house is torn apart. Cut to BLAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!...    DADDY!! A light comes on.   John steps out of his bedroom and ent his son's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.     Just a bad dream. He comes back out carrying Luke, now SIX YEARS-OLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John lays Luke on the bed and climbs in beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you can sleep here as long as you stay on this side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke immediately scrambles over his father to take his si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a snake, I don't know why I keep falling for the same trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John kisses Luke, who closes his eyes and snuggles his pi John reaches for the lamp. Beside it sits the framed phot that Lara snapped of the three of them that fateful morni He switches off the lamp, and the screen goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "T," the city's fast-moving trolley, rises up from underground and we CRANE UP to see the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sam's your friend, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tilt down from a passing T-Train to find John and Luke, walking toward the huge, modern Allegheny County Jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he take your food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say something mean? (Luke nods) About Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hit him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.    Where did you hit him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the swings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.    I bet that hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - John waits in a long line, mostly women. He glances ove at the pleasant and colorful play area in the corner and sees children playing. Luke plays by himself. - John puts his key ring in a plastic container. The guar takes it and puts the keys with other visitors' belonging John guides his son toward the metal detector. Luke walks through and the buzzer goes off. John instinctively moves forward to help. A guard stops h with a hand on his chest. On the other side of the metal detector another guard runs a wand over Luke, pulls somet from his pocket, looks at it curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a toy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard runs the wand over the child again; no screech. The guard waves John through. No beep. John kneels and pulls on Luke's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.     We'll get it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk along the hall with all the other visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares out the window at the city beyond.    Life se so close. He looks back into the large communal visiting room; a do round tables and plastic chairs. The concrete block walls are covered with naive paintings in bright colors and mes of hope. Luke plays at his feet with a basket of Legos. The door at the far side buzzes, a guard opens it and prisoners in red jump-suits marked VISITING ROOM enter. Lara enters and looks around. She is pale, thin and her hair has returned to its natural color. Lara hurries to h and gives him a real kiss. She breaks and steps to Luke, who plays with his back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi honey. Can Mommy get a kiss? (no response. Tickles him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, give Mommy a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rat-Bag.   Give Mommy a kiss. He gives her a peck on the cheek and goes back to his Leg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Daddy reading you my letters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every night at bedtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you building?    A fort? Lara pulls him into a hug; no response. She kisses his he and sits at the table with John. She squeezes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he scared going to school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walked him to class, gave him a kiss; he didn't even look back to wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you make him for lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turkey sandwich, just butter and bread, no "vegetables" on it. He swore he ate his apple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a pack of photos.      Lara devours them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at his friends.   And his desk. This is his teacher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Phillips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may have to move to another school district.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already spoke to a realtor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still looking at photos) How was your first day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. Over half my class stayed awake. Talked to your mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When is she coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's having a lot of trouble with her business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only been a couple of years, I'm sure she'll get around to it. (beat) Have you heard anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the appeal? Yes, and I'm just not telling you. What did Meyer say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Don't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It can take months for the court to rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw that woman. She was there. She couldn't have just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meyer's looking for a new investigator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her coat snagged my purse, I felt a button pop - they must have been blind not to find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll go through all the evidence again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, because I haven't quite bankrupted us yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fondly) You just lie and lie. (strokes his face) But you are very handsome. (admiring him) Can you do me a favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I'm a little busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to run for governor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Oh, that I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can change this rule about no conjugal visits, because I don't think I can last another twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles but is already traveling toward a dark place. reaches out and holds her tight, stroking her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.   I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But it's going to be fine. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just stares at Luke, his back to them, playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he'll ever want to kiss me again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners file out and are patted down. Lara turns an blows Luke and John a kiss. They watch with the other visitors, who all stand on the far side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara and the female inmates pull off their visiting jump- suits and hand them to a female guard, who searches them contraband. Lara retrieves her regular jump-suit and pull it on over her underwear. Another small, daily humiliatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start VERY CLOSE ON JOHN'S DIGITAL WATCH. Widen to see Lu standing on a low step at the sink in his pajamas using a complicated-looking electric toothbrush. John sits on the toilet, staring at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-eight, twenty-nine, thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke puts it down and checks his teeth in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage door opens; the Prius has a lot more miles on John backs out, Luke in his child seat. He brakes and fin PAULA, the woman who lives behind them, at his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Lara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's doing okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her we're pulling for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up a plastic water bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't recycle these unless you take off the cap. (cap vs. bottle) This is trash. This is recyclable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.   Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drives off, wondering what kind of world he lives in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on the park bench, John allows his feelings to wa over his face. He watches Luke play with a girl his age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke!   Let's go, Toad.   Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke runs to him. John pulls Luke's jacket on. He doesn't notice the young mother on the next bench, NICOLE, watchi him admiringly. She calls to the girl Luke was playing wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go, Carrie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John glances in time to see CARRIE plop down in the sand, arms folded. He shares a sympathetic smile with Nicole, w heads to retrieve her daughter. John walks off with Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John waits as a courtroom lets out. MEYER FISK steps out with a young associate. He spots John and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I said my office at four o'clock. I can't leave, I'm in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up a Subway bag) I figured you had to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meyer relents, turns and calls to his associate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the ruling in Brennan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels and digs through her rolling briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits on a bench, pale and shaken, flipping through t ruling. The courtroom is empty, save a bailiff eating at his desk. During this he gets up and walks out past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if we find the woman who                         was leaving the parking lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PCRA was rejected. No new evidence can be submitted. Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a robbery!   Someone stole her purse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they'd used her credit cards we would have had something to argue. I'm sorry; this really...sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John offers a smile at Meyer's unlawyer-like choice of wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, that's it. Now we just have the Supreme Court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, in the last thirty years, the Supreme Court hasn't heard one murder case. No decent lawyer would even file the pleadings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I need to find an indecent one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm going to file it. But I need you to do something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to look at the evidence and just forget Lara is your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopped by that) I've seen the evidence, Meyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying judge her innocent or guilty, I'm just saying look at it. He co-worker sees her leaving the scene, she has the victim's blood on her clothes, her fingerprints on the murder weapon--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (is this a bad joke?) We went out for dinner! How do you do that after you kill somebody? She would have to be a psychopath!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And the fight in the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone fights with their boss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this one ended up dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks at Meyer anew, feeling profoundly betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you never believed she was innocent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are you saying, Meyer?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it no longer matters what we believe; Lara's not getting out. And you have no idea how much I hate saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exiting) I'll find someone to file the pleadings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! Come on! For Christ's sake. JOHN!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is long gone.    Meyer hurls his sandwich into the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John waits alone on the visitors' side of the glass. The door opens, and Lara steps up on the other side. John smi and picks up the phone, but Lara sees something in his fa and doesn't pick up her phone, just stares at him. John fights to keep his smile and nods for her to pick up her phone -- but now she can see the verdict chiseled on face. Lara gasps and cries inconsolably. John keeps the smile plastered on his face, but now tears run down his cheeks. He taps on the glass and points at h phone, but she doesn't respond. He taps harder and harder desperately wanting to comfort her, but she won't allow i He bangs on the glass with his fist, drawing the attentio of the guard on his side. Lara turns and exits. John stands and yells her name, but she can't hear it, and neither can we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in an old working class neighborhood.    John sits his car, trying to pull himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICK opens the door. GRACE, their mother, looks up from clearing the lunch dishes. John's face tells them everyth they need to know. Mick slams his fist against the door. In the back yard with Luke, GEORGE, John's father turns t see Grace tearfully embrace John. George looks away, uncomfortable, and distracts Luke's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Mick and Grace sit in the worn wicker chairs on the back porch. Erit steps out with beers to replace their empties. She sits and they stare off, watching Luke and George play with the dog. After a moment Erit looks to Jo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you won't want to hear this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Erit, go put somebody to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares unbelieving, then walks off in a huff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to be done. (long beat) I am really going to pay for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John has to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drives through a rough part of town on their way hom He stops at a light and notes the dealers on the corner. flashy car pulls up, hands are slapped; call the driver D He takes a roll of cash from the dealer, looks around, ca John staring. John looks away quickly and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits at his desk, surrounded by boxes of documents a photographs. As John sifts through the evidence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara and her boss ELIZABETH argue loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's RAINING outside. ELIZABETH stands at her car door in small, partially covered garage -- maybe a dozen spots. S turns toward camera -- A FIRE EXTINGUISHER comes right at camera, making a terri impact and ELIZABETH collapses to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara turns, holding the fire extinguisher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he flips through a handwritten witness statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara's car speeds out of the parking lot. A male co-worke steps out of the rain just as her car passes. He stops as he sees ELIZABETH'S BODY lying beside her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara tries to scrub the blood off of her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone beside him SHRIEKS.   John picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late; prime time for the ER.    John runs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters breathlessly and finds the Nurses' Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara Brennan; my wife. She was sent up here. Brennan. B-R-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finds name in roster)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't have visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous; I have to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. John turns away and heads down the corridor to find her himself. The Duty Nurse sees this and takes off after him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go down there! John shoves open a door, moves on to the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be in here!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running up) I got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long-haired doctor, BECSEY, steps into his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife attempted suicide.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL GUARD 1 DUTY NURSE
dialogues.text: Let's go.                                (hands doctor ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to see her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't she in the ER?

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL GUARD 1 DUTY NURSE
dialogues.text: I'm not asking. Now.                   She's a transfer f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.   Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becsey is not unmoved.       He shares a look with the nu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. Becsey opens the door for John.          Note a priso standing outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becsey leaves. A uniformed female prison guard looks up from her magazine and keeps her eyes on John. He looks to his wife, who's attached to an I.V. and monitors, pale an weak, her arm bandaged where she cut it open along the ar Lara opens her heavy eyelids and John glimpses something terrible in her eyes: she's tortured to be alive. He knee beside her and puts a hand on the bed. She takes his litt finger, wraps her fingers around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John opens the door to let Jenna out; she looks considera older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He just keeps pretending he's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for his wallet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist.    I kept you out on a school night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in school anymore. She offers a sad smile and leaves without the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke lies in the crook of his father's arm, his own arms full of penguins, turtles, a black dog and an opossum. Jo reads him a letter, the yellow envelope open on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give a big hug to Pengui, Little Pengui, Big Turtley, Little Turtley, Kiki and Opossumy. Lots and lots of love, Mommy. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna give them hugs from her? (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we write her back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...When is she coming home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon honey.    Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks for a moment, then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a quarter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you have a quarter?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luke points at the glass coin dish on night stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh. Sure, but you can't spend those. They come from the cottage where Mommy and I used to take you when you were a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then can I have them all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Luke the jar, and hoists up him and his animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke sets the coin jar on his nightstand. John tucks him with his animals, then switches off the lamp. John looks back before closing it and watches Luke lie awake, starin at the jar, lost in confused thoughts of his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty dishes piled in the sink, John unloads the dishwash He finds the handle has cracked off Luke's favorite mug. places the cup and handle on the counter, opens a drawer crammed with tools and screws and tape and such. He rumma through it. Not finding what he is looking for, he pulls handfuls of junk out of the drawer and slams it all down the counter. The harder he searches the more he becomes frustrated, until he slams the drawer and leans on the counter, feeling destroyed and needy. And then a female hand appears beside him, opens another drawer and reaches in. John stares at the hand, afraid to move, afraid to look up. The hand finds a tube of glue, places it on the counter and moves away. John turns to see LARA walking away. She turns, smiling a shaking her head, and disappears into the dining room. Stunned, John looks down at the glue on the counter, then suddenly pushes away and rushes into the dining room. No sign of her. And she isn't in the living room. He bolts into the foyer and finds the front door slightly ajar. He flings it open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John rushes out into the street, looking up and down for finally realizing she was never there.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stands in the middle of the street, now searching for way to survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Quixote is written on the chalkboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what is it about?   Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That belief in someone's virtue is more important than virtue itself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean, yes, that's in there. But what is it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No takers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is about how rational thought destroys the soul. It is about the triumph of irrationality, and the power that is in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drops an armload of books into a library cart, each having something to do with prison or prison life. He sits at a table at the back, flipping through them one a time and discards each in turn. As the shadows grow longer we find him staring at the com screen linked to the school system. ON THE SCREEN: a book summary disappears, to be replaced the school search engine -- many of the items have alread been inspected. John finds one that reads "Over The Walls He clicks on the link and the title page appears. The aut is DAMON PENNINGTON. There's a photo of him. The caption reads that he LIVES IN BROOKLYN, NY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets out of a cab and heads into a local dive bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of guys at the bar yell at the dog race on the T screen. DAMON hands John a beer and nods toward a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a course that investigates what drives men to be free, no matter the cost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody else had dibs on Papillon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You escaped from jail seven times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon lights a cigarette.       A TOUGH GUY nearby object

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No smoking!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, who would want to cut short your precious life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon takes a deep drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I tape you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it, it can't be used as evidence. What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sets up the small digital recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you escaped when no one else could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balls and a little luck. (beat) No prison in the world is airtight. Each one has a key. You have to find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of looking. Especially at things that break the daily routine. Guards get comfortable doing the same thing every day. Something happens where they have to think, adapt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when they will make mistakes. But when you see it you have to be ready. You have to have the entire plan already in place before you even know how you are going to get out of the jail. Escaping is easy; the hardest part is staying free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape recorder plays Damon's voice; John tears large s of art paper from a pad and tacks them to his bedroom wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to know where you are going to go and how you are going to get there. You have to know how they plan to catch you, where, and when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to write on the paper with a large felt marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pay off someone who knows. And a lot depends on if the prison is in the country or the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That came out too quickly. Damon now understands. John sits, silent, knowing he blew it. Damon takes his time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Pittsburgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pittsburgh is tough; so many bridges and tunnels they can block off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The art paper bunches and rips under the pressure of the marker. John tears it off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the time they make the call, the police can have the center of the city sealed tight in fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can they be so exact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After 9-11 Homeland Security made every city have a lock-down plan -- downtown Pittsburgh, Philly, Boston, Minneapolis -- fifteen minutes. They can do DC in under ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John draws a circle on the wall and writes in it: 15 MINU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within thirty-five minutes they will have cops at every tollbooth on the interstate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Surrounds it by a larger circle: 35 MINUTES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be running rolling stops on the secondary roads. They won't have your photograph yet, but they will have your description.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws spokes out from the circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you can't make it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five minutes isn't a lot of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they will shoot you on sight, along with anyone you are with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John writes DESCRIPTION at the end of one spoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay far away from the train and bus stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the local airports.   Leave from another state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John scribbles key words on the wall.     DISTANT AIRPORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second: identity. It's easy to find fake papers, harder to find ones that will get you through an airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John writes "IDENTITIES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need a passport, driver's license and a social security number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have to rent a car, find a place that will take a cash deposit. They'll still run a credit check, so use a real person's name on the ID. (beat) Third: destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John writes furiously on the wall.    "DESTINATION."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want somewhere that doesn't attract American tourists and doesn't get American newspapers. Think Yemen and you get the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's writes "MONEY."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a truck load of it. Everything's expensive: hotels, travel, information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to last at least five-six years. Run out of money and you run out of friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John underlines "MONEY."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is starting to understand the enormity of this undertaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before you do anything, you have to ask yourself if you can do it. Can you forget about ever seeing your parents again. Can you kill a guard, leave your kid at a gas station, push a nice old lady to the ground because she is between you and the door? Because to do this thing, that's who you have to become. And if you can't, don't start, because you'll just get someone killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John backs away from the wall to see it covered in a spid of notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave myself up. I couldn't take wondering when someone was going to come through the bedroom door. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got what you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have in your pocket? John opens his billfold.   Damon takes the cash, leaves h twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wall we see the massive diagram John has created. The screen goes BLACK. Read: THE LAST THREE MONTHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train crosses a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John rides, looking down at the river below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John steps through the puffer (the machine that detects d and into the secure area. He makes a mental note of everything he sees: the number of guards, cameras, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits in his car on the road above, surreptitiously t pictures of the vehicles coming and going from the prison

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tapes the photos to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking down a corridor with the other visitors, John ste in a puddle of water. Behind him the others notice and st around it. Moving on, they pass a trustee on a ladder pul a water-stained ceiling tile away as two guards watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John traces a route on a map with a highlighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall grows thick with photos and notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reads an article on his computer -- about illegal alie and fake ID's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters his bedroom and closes the door. We see how dramatically his plan has evolved on the wall as every in is covered in notes, photos, maps, and various writings. studies it as he bites into a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Luke walk near the front of the group of visitor toward the visitation rooms. Just ahead he notices a guard using a key to call the elevator. John stops near the elevator and kneels, pullin one of Luke's shoelaces loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was already tied. John reties the lace as the group moves on.    He keeps o eye on the elevator. The door opens and the guard   steps in - and John notice WORKMEN in hardhats inside.    The elevator closes, the s is tied, the group has moved   on down the hall and they alone. John pulls the laces    and unties Luke's shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You untied it again!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The guard looks back, now impatient. John offers a smile and throws a look down at the elevator tread, sees the na OTIS ELEVATOR COMPANY. Suddenly a voice comes from behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Brennan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, John turns to see DR. LIFSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We met briefly. Byrdie Lifson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry.    Hello, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to approaching guard) I'll bring them back myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John leaves Luke playing and steps into the office. Lifso partially closes the door, so John can still see his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We check your wife's blood regularly. She's been refusing her insulin. I don't want to sound dramatic, but it's just another form of suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she doesn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to her. (steps out)                                            Let's go, Squirrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Luke wait. The prisoners enter.      Lara looks terrible. John stands and embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.    I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lara smiles to cover and bends down and kisses her son, w is engrossed in his toys as usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sweet potato. How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't respond. She kisses him on the head then takes seat. John sits beside her. They speak in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor told me about the insulin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching Luke) Yeah, I forgot. It's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot?    For how many days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot, okay? I have things on my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --And so much to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I please just watch him play? Tell me about kindergarten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I need you to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I won't forget again, okay? (trying to fight away these thoughts:) I am just never going to walk him to school or wash his clothes or make him dinner...and I don't know how I can live knowing that. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara. Look at me. Something will happen. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cruelly - but hushed) What? What is going to happen? There are no more appeals, there are no more anything. Exactly what miracle are we hoping for, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down, beaten.      She lets go of her anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to do something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop bringing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hates coming here.   Look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. It's not his fault. It's too hard to watch him forget me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks at his son, playing at a distance, his back to them. It's hard to argue with her, she's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to hear something funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother tried to send me anti-aging cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John smiles, but like hers it may be the saddest smile in the world. They sit and watch Luke play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John checks his bank statements and adds them up on the w under MONEY. The total is $8,840.00. He stares at that figure for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EUGENIE, the REAL ESTATE AGENT, walks John to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure that you don't want a lawn sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sure. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STUDENT shows John how to use Photoshop to enlarge and crop a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John uses Photoshop, looking through family pictures for appropriate one to use for Lara's ID. Some of them are of the family at a cottage. He finds one that will work and starts to crop himself and Luke (as a baby) out of the ph Then he turns and notices Luke standing behind him, stari at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter swoops over a bridge and traces the Monongah River through the city. On the door of the helicopter is emblazoned the name of a local tour company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits among six other passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the left, Allegheny County Jail. Built in 1995, it is now the largest jail in the world. There have been three escape attempts. No one's made it out alive. On your right... Everyone else looks to the right as the pilot continues. John stays fixed on the left window.

dialogues.speaker: HIS POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: The massive rooftops of the jail. But then he sees exactl what he is looking for: workmen wearing yellow helmets sp hot tar and roofing paper. He spots a workman carrying a bucket heading around a tall outcropping on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLA, a student, reads from The Idiot as John returns to desk with papers in his hands. His laptop lies open to Go Earth -- the rooftop view of the jail, from another angle John closes it and spreads the papers on his desk -- a pr color version of the same. He draws an arrow to the outcropping where we now see a door; labels it ELEVATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the first landing, which was as small as the necessary turn of the stairs allowed, there was a niche in the column, about a yard wide, and in this niche the prince felt convinced that a man stood concealed. He thought he could distinguish a figure standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John searches Craigslist for HELICOPTER PILOTS. Clicks on one that reads EXPERIENCED HELICOPTER PILOT, COMBAT VET, WILL CONSIDER ANY OFFER.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN'S WALL
dialogues.text: Where a magazine clipping of a helicopter sits under the heading ESCAPE. Overlapping it he pins trimmed print-outs of several PILOT candidates. Directly underneath is the Google Earth photo of the roof of the jail, the door marked with an arrow, and the landi site indicated with an X in a circle. Below that is a rough sketch of the visitor's room and th adjacent corridor with an arrow marking the elevator. In block letters beside it is the word "KEY?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, John and George stand in the foyer, Luke with his c sized, brightly-colored overnight bag. John pulls off Luk coat, kisses him on the head and looks up at George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. George nods, takes Luke's hand and walks to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drives, taking note of the corners where young men h out, selling drugs or contraband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks up to a guy leaning on the bumper of his car, trunk partially open. Call him MOUSS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adderall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten apiece, five for forty. John hands him a twenty, Mouss digs into a bag in his tru and hands him a blister-pack strip of two pills, samples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some passports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off. John nods and walks back across the street.   The guy wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John climbs into his car and tosses the pills onto the passenger seat, among a half dozen others. There is a sha RAP on his window; Mouss. John rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to pay up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the Uptown on 5th Ave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask for Harv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just say Mouss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John parks and steps out of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hip-hop blares, the clientele are low-lives, John doesn't exactly fit in as he enters and orders. His words are dro out. The bartender gives him a beer on tap. John asks for "Hart." The bartender nods to a man at the back who is playing a video game. John walks off, passing a LONG-HAIR GUY at the bar who watches him. John approaches HARV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouss said to come see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did, did he? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three passports, a driver's license, and real social security number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know Mouss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He babysits my kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sizes him up, then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Harv gives him a look; nods for him to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the photos on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen hundred. MOUSS steps out of the shadows and cracks John across the back of the head with a pipe. John stumbles to the ground The two men kick the shit out of John.   John tries to pr his face; they just keep kicking.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mouss finally grabs John's hair and flicks a knife in his face as Harv searches his pockets and finds his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ever see you again, you lose an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men walk away and get into Mouss' van. John lies doubled up on the ground and eventually tries to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John cleans the cuts on his face with peroxide, adds a Ba Aid. He stares at his face, letting defeat wash over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John deducts $2,000 from the MONEY column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face purple with bruises, John pulls himself out of b in response to the RINGING DOORBELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John limps to the front door and opens it to see Eugenie, his realtor, standing with a nice couple. They see his fa try and hide their reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did remember I was showing the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tacks two large dark blue sheets up over the wall, covering his plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugenie reassures her skittish clients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really is a great neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, John's mother, opens the door and sees John's face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my lord!     What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits as Grace approaches with iodine and cotton ball Through the window he sees Luke playing with the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was stupid, I fell off the bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bike that's been in our garage for two years? Put your head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guy made a crack about Lara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, that's what you do now: punch everyone who thinks she's guilty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means it's important what YOU believe, not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   So, what do you believe, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands and opens the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you trying to start a fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out back door) Come on, buddy! (to his mother) Where is his bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke enters as Grace tries to hide her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason. I just stupidly thought people who loved her would actually believe she's innocent. My mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns and sees GEORGE standing in the open doorway. has heard everything. He gives his son a dismissive look and walks off towards his bedroom. John feels like a heel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Luke) Give Grandma a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke does, and the two of them leave with his bag. 116   EXT. GRACE & GEORGE'S - INSIDE THE PRIUS -- DAY John gets in and checks his mirror.   Luke is staring at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your face hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hit him back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drives, looking for someone selling fake papers. He sees Mouss' parked car and slows; Mouss stares at him. Jo flashes his middle finger and drives on. Mouss considers doing something but just flips him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John asks a couple of guys on the corner about papers and turned away. As he returns to his car, he doesn't notice MIKE, the long-haired guy from Drake's Bar, watching from astride his motorcycle. A SECOND RIDER pulls up beside Mi John pulls out and the motorcycles follow at a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John watches Jenna leave; closes the door, climbs the sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sees Luke sleeping, surrounded by his animals. doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John peers out surreptitiously, sees MIKE standing there. He rings the bell again. John runs and snatches a kitchen knife, returns to the do secures the chain lock and opens the door a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Mike speaks in a loud, atonal and unnerving voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at the bar.    I know what you are looking for. Caught off guard by the voice, John just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm deaf, you idiot. I read lips. John stares at him, unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to talk out here? John puts the knife in his back pocket and steps out onto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John tries to look tough.     Mike smiles at John's brava

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need? John indicates Mike should lower his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three passports, a driver's license and social security number that can take a credit check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seven hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is if you never get them. I need photos and a thousand in advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares at the man, trying to read him.       He turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls cash and an envelope from his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike counts the money and shoves it in his breast pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring them Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.   Don't come here again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stares at him.      John stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parking lot of Don's. Eckert Street. Under the bridge; two o'clock. If I'm not there on time, leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John closes the door behind him and watches Mike walk off toward his motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the carving knife back in the drawer. As he look up, he sees THE SECOND RIDER staring in the window, his h still on. John's heart almost stops. The rider DRIVES OFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat-up old van sits parked on the crumbling sidewalk. John hands seven hundred dollars to a sketchy-looking guy inside. The guy hands John a 9MM handgun wrapped in a oilcloth. John unwraps it and hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me how to load it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Luke enter the back door. Luke automatically hea for the living room. John calls after him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No video game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John moves to check the answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll play checkers with you after dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll just lose again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on voicemail:) John? It's Eugenie. You're not going to believe it; the people I brought over? They made an offer! I'll bring it in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buoyed/to Luke) Not tonight. Tonight, I utterly destroy you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John watches a video on YouTube: "How to unlock any door. The person on screen demonstrates how to make a "bump key

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a bump key. First, find any key that fits into the same make of lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John files down a key, held in the jaws of a vice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John inserts the bump key into the door lock, bumps it wi the butt of a screwdriver. The key won't turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He files down the key some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He inserts the key, bumps it, turns.     The lock opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets in, heading up to his classroom. People avoid looking at his face. One woman can't help noticing. John nods and smiles. He pushes the elevator button and notice the name: OTIS ELEVATOR COMPANY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John scans the room as he waits. Two children play in the set that is used to teach them how to speak to a prisoner behind glass using a phone. A moment later, a woman enter with a large shoulder bag. She is a NOTARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Brennan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No other visitors today.     A NOTARY sits with Lara and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just put your thumb there. And Lara puts her thumb print on the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, that's all I need. The notary heads for the door.     John turns to the fema guard who is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just be a moment. He turns back to his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching him, melting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your poor face. How could you do that to yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am useless without you.    I can't even ride a bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's very sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry we had to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have nothing to apologize for. But you should have told me before this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you not telling me things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From now on I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I won't know where to picture you. (off his look) I close my eyes and I see Luke in his bedroom, you on the sofa by the Window. I won't know where to picture you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares at his laptop as the class does a test. Knowi he isn't paying attention, a STUDENT angles his multiple choice test so that his friend behind can see the answers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John waits for the janitor to leave his tiny office and g the door before it closes. He slips inside and finds a ra with keys. He takes one from the hook marked ELEVATORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John files down the elevator key as he did the house key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John moves aside a box on the shelf and removes the handg wrapped in an old chamois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to see Paula standing in the open garage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John tries to look casual as he stands with the thinly disguised gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if I could ask you to water my plants next week; I'm going in for an operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's nothing serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My idiot doctor misdiagnosed me. He's blaming the lab; the lab's blaming him. But I'll be fine. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she walks off.    John gets in the car and slips the between the seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls into the empty parking lot beside Don's and wa Checks his watch: 1:49 PM. A car pulls in. The guy sits there for a second, then gets out and enters the restaura

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John checks his watch. 2:14. He looks around, knowing he is supposed to leave. He makes a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English Department, this is Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. It's John. Luke isn't feeling well, I'm going to take him home. I need Carl to cover my 2:30 class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will let him know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John checks his watch: 2:27. His cell phone rings, displa the name MICK; John presses IGNORE. He feels for the gun between the seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy comes out of the restaurant. John watches him wal to his car. The man sees him and stares back. John checks his watch. 2:45. The guy drives off, leaving the lot empt

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John presses the VOICEMAIL button on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ever going to answer your goddamn phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a man in a helmet raps on his side window and Jo realizes MIKE has pulled up without him noticing. His han goes to the split between the seats, but stops short as t SECOND RIDER pulls up to the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You notice that guy was a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with the red light in his back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John feels ridiculous.       Mike hands him the documents

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hands him the envelope of money.       Mike checks i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want this too much. You're going to fuck it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike speeds off. The second rider gives John a look and follows. John looks over the passports with their new nam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke gets out of the car and heads into the house, swingi his lunch pale. John watches him go, then reaches down be his seat and pulls out the gun, wrapped in a cloth. He hi it in the garage and thinks about what he is doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John moves through the line toward the metal detector. He takes his key ring out of his pocket and slips it, and th separate elevator bump key, into a white plastic dish and

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: places it atop the X-ray machine. He steps through the me detector and then grabs the plastic dish before the guard get to it. He hands the dish to the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John puts the dish down, and we see the bump key is gone John palmed it. The guard dumps John's key ring on the counter with the keys and cell phones from the other visi JOHN pockets the palmed key as he enters the jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John moves down the hall with the fifty or so other visit He eases toward the elevator, keeping his eye on the guar ahead. By the time the group stops for the door ahead to open, John's managed to be right beside the elevator. He folds his coat over his arm to block others from seein and feels for the slot. Finding it, he slips in the bump key. It fits. The guard at the lead opens the door to the first visitin room and the crowd starts moving again. John quickly bump the key and turns it -- but it won't turn. He bumps it ag Visitors keep moving past him. He looks over his shoulder, sees the guard following them preoccupied at the door. He turns it harder. Nothing.     He tries to pull it out. It's stuck. John panics. The rear guard closes the entry door and follows the crow John tugs at it one last time, and then turns it hard and snaps it off in the lock. A BLACK WOMAN among the visitor sees what he is doing but averts her eyes. John drops the rest of the broken key and kicks it into t slot between the elevator and the shaft. He slips back in the crowd and moves on. Near the rear of the crowd now, John approaches the door the visiting room.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He throws a look back, sees another guard step up and try insert his key in the elevator. John rounds the corner into the visiting room. The camera stays on his face until we finally hear A DEAFENING ALARM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John waits in a line against the wall, beside a door to a small office. Through the glass he watches the MAJOR interview the black woman who noticed what he was doing. She nods and leaves, passing him with a look. The Major holds the door open for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAJOR plays John the CCTV video from the corridor. He flips between two camera positions at either end of the h The crowd of visitors shuffling toward the visiting rooms obscures the view of the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you are where in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...In the middle there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle. Can you point to yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks) It's hard to tell.   I think that's me there. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freezes the tape and points to a blurry figure in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's not you there.   By the elevator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks) ....No. (points to another person) I was over here. You want to tell me what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major holds the piece of the key that jammed in the l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what a bump key is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major puts it on the desk and just stares at John.    Fin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this was you, you might want to think about what's going to happen to your kids if both of their parents are in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The major stares right through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John heads toward the exit, accompanied by a guard. As he nears the elevator he sees a technician climbing a step ladder, holding a new CCTV camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face chalk white, John heads for the exit, fighting the u to run. The door opens just before he gets there and Coll steps in, Quinn holding the door for her. John charges pa noticing neither of them -- but Quinn recognizes him. Qui turns and watches as John doubles over the short wall nea and vomits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The worst date you've ever been on? This was worse. And this guy? He really thinks he is doing great. Then he's driving me home and I know he's going to try and kiss me, so I pretend to fall asleep. I mean, I'm actually snoring, right in his car. Does that stop him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns and notices Quinn, behind the door, watching h They lock eyes. Collero realizes that Quinn isn't paying attention and wonders what he's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John turns and walks away.     Quinn keeps watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you not to date cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collero's eyes find John as well.      He disappears arou corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John rides home, devastated that his plan has failed, and wondering what he will do. He checks over his shoulder to make sure he isn't being followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits on the bare wood floor of the living room. His head turns as he hears someone POUNDING on the front door He throws a look to the garage, thinks about the gun; dismisses the idea. Then he hears the voice: his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me in, asshole!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick bangs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up! (more banging) Your car is in the garage, I know you're in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John doesn't move. As we pull back we see that the living room and dining room have been stripped of every bit of furniture, save an old TV set sitting on a box. John know he can't let his brother see this. The MALE NEIGHBOR in the house to the south opens his doo and looks out and scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem? He's not home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not home?   So you're saying I'm blind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
